Uruguay

Group A | South America

El Chivito

You'll need a bite as gnarly as Luis Su치rez to fit this monstrous sandwich in your mouth. A riff on Jamie Oliver's, this is a staple on menus in cafes across Uruguay.

The sandwich that started it all. El Chivito is the national dish of Uruguay, and from it's imposing stature it's hard to imagine there ever being a challenger to that title.

  • Time 1hr
  • Makes 6
  • Difficulty Professional
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 100g Mayonnaise
    ½ cup
    100g
    Mayonnaise
  • 2 tbsp Lemon juice
    2 tbsp
    2 tbsp
    Lemon juice
  • 4 tbsp Olive oil
    4 tbsp
    4 tbsp
    Olive oil
  • 2 cloves Garlic
    2 cloves
    2 cloves
    Garlic crushed
  • 56g Butter
    4 tbsp 2 tbsp
    56g 28g
    Butter
  • 4 pieces Bacon
    4 pieces
    4 pieces
    Bacon
  • 2 slices Cooked ham
    2 slices
    2 slices
    Cooked ham
  • 225g Sirloin steak
    ½ lb
    225g
    Sirloin steak as thin as possible
  • 2 Eggs
    2
    2
    Eggs
  • 1 Large loaf of bread
    1
    1
    Large loaf of bread sliced lengthwise
  • 120g Queso blanco
    ¼ lb
    120g
    Queso blanco thinly sliced
  • 1 Tomato
    1
    1
    Tomato thinly sliced
  • 4 leaves Lettuce
    4 leaves
    4 leaves
    Lettuce
  • 1
    Prepare the aioli by mixing together the mayonnaise, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic and salt and pepper. Whisk until smooth and set aside
  • 2
    Over a high heat, add 2 tbsp28g butter in a frying pan and cook the bacon. Remove from the pan, but leave the drippings behind.
  • 3
    Add the ham slices to the bacon grease and brown on the outside. Remove and set aside. Using a paper towel wipe the grease from the pan.
  • 4
    Season the steaks with salt and pepper, melt the rest of the butter in the pan and fry steaks one at a time. Cook to your liking.
  • 5
    In a small frying pan, heat olive oil and fry the eggs one at a time. Season with salt and pepper.
  • 6
    Cut the bread lengthwise and spread the aioli evenly on both sides.
  • 7
    Layer the meats - first add the steaks, then the ham and then the bacon.
  • 8
    Next add the Queso blanco cheese and top with the eggs.
  • 9
    Lightly place the tomato slices and lettuce on top, and finally the top half of the bread. Be careful not to break the egg yolks.
